title: Store Manager - Transportation
description:
**Position Title:** Store Manager - Transportation

**Position Overview:**  
As a Store Manager in the transportation industry, you will be responsible for overseeing the efficient operation of the company's store or warehouse facility. Your primary objective will be to manage inventory, streamline logistics processes, and ensure the timely and accurate distribution of goods to customers.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Inventory Management:**
* Maintain accurate inventory records and ensure adequate stock levels to meet customer demand.
* Monitor inventory turnover and implement strategies to minimize stock shortages and excess inventory.
* Coordinate with suppliers to replenish stock and negotiate favorable pricing terms.
* **Logistics and Distribution:**
* Coordinate the receipt, storage, and distribution of goods according to company policies and procedures.
* Optimize logistics processes to maximize efficiency and minimize transportation costs.
* Ensure timely loading and unloading of shipments to meet delivery schedules.
* **Team Leadership and Supervision:**
* Recruit, train, and supervise store staff to ensure a high level of performance and customer service.
* Schedule and assign tasks to warehouse personnel to optimize productivity and resource utilization.
* Provide coaching and feedback to team members to foster professional development and growth.
* **Safety and Compliance:**
* Enforce safety regulations and compliance standards to maintain a safe working environment.
* Conduct regular safety inspections and implement corrective actions as needed.
* Ensure adherence to all applicable laws, regulations, and company policies.
* **Customer Service:**
* Address customer inquiries and concerns in a timely and professional manner.
* Collaborate with the sales team to fulfill customer orders and resolve delivery issues.
* Strive to exceed customer expectations and build long-term relationships.
* **Quality Control:**
* Implement quality control measures to ensure the accuracy and integrity of stored inventory.
* Conduct periodic audits and inspections to identify and rectify any quality issues.
* Collaborate with vendors and suppliers to maintain product quality standards.

**Qualifications and Skills:**

* Bachelor's degree in business administration, logistics, or a related field.
* Proven experience in store management, warehouse operations, or logistics management.
* Strong leadership and supervisory skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
* Proficiency in inventory management software and systems.
* Knowledge of transportation regulations and industry best practices.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.

**Additional Requirements:**

* Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Physical stamina to lift and move heavy objects if required.
* Forklift certification or willingness to obtain certification.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: ₹15,872.27 - ₹40,389.16 per month

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Provident Fund

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Morning shift
* Rotational shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Overtime pay
* Performance bonus
* Yearly bonus

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* total work: 1 year (Preferred)
* Management: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* Hindi (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Application Deadline: 22/04/2024  
Expected Start Date: 27/04/2024

title: Business - Senior Manager
description:
**Job Description**

**About Groww**  

We are a passionate group of people focused on making financial services accessible to every Indian through a multi-product platform. Each day, we help millions of customers take charge of their financial journey. Customer obsession is in our DNA. Every product, every design, every algorithm down to the tiniest detail is executed keeping the customers’ needs and convenience in mind. Our people are our greatest strength. Everyone at Groww is driven by ownership, customer-centricity, integrity and the passion to constantly challenge the status quo.
Are you as passionate about defying conventions and creating something extraordinary as we are? Let’s chat. **Our Vision**
Every individual deserves the knowledge, tools, and confidence to make informed financial decisions. At Groww, we are making sure every Indian feels empowered to do so through a cutting-edge multi-product platform offering a variety of financial services. Our long-term vision is to become the trusted financial partner for millions of Indians. **Our Values**
Our culture enables us to be what we are — India’s fastest-growing financial services company. It fosters an environment where collaboration, transparency, and open communication take center-stage and hierarchies fade away. There is space for every individual to be themselves and feel motivated to bring their best to the table, as well as craft a promising career for themselves.
The values that form our foundation are:* Radical customer centricity
* Ownership-driven culture
* Keeping everything simple
* Long-term thinking
* Complete transparency
**Job Requirement**


As a Manager/Senior Manager at Groww, you will be responsible for driving the overall growth, profitability, and market share of your assigned category. You will develop and execute both short-term and long-term strategies to ensure the category’s success. This role requires a combination of strategic thinking, data-driven decision-making, and strong cross-functional collaboration. **Key Responsibilities:*** **Category Strategy**: Develop and implement a comprehensive category strategy that aligns with the company’s overall objectives. This includes setting clear short-term and long-term goals, financial targets, and KPIs.
* **Customer Insights**: Gather and analyse customer feedback and insights to better understand customer preferences and behaviours. Use this information to enhance the category’s offerings.
* **Product Strategy**: Identify opportunities for new product development and innovation within the category. Collaborate with product development teams to bring new products to market. Manage the category’s product strategy ensuring that the product features meets customer needs and aligns with the category strategy.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration**: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including growth, operations, and product development, to ensure seamless execution of category strategies and initiatives.
* **Financial Performance**: Track and manage the financial performance of the category, including sales, margins, and profitability. Identify areas for improvement and take corrective actions when necessary.
* **Market Analysis**: Conduct thorough market research and analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and threats within the category. Stay informed about competitor activities and market dynamics.
* **Promotions and Marketing**: Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute promotional campaigns and marketing initiatives to drive category growth. Monitor campaign effectiveness and adjust strategies as needed.
* **Vendor Relationships**: Build and maintain strong relationships with vendors and suppliers. Negotiate favourable terms and agreements to optimise cost, quality, and availability of products within the category
* **Compliance and Risk Management**: Ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies within the category. Identify and mitigate risks that could impact category performance.


Requirements & Qualifications:* Proven experience in category management, product management, or related roles.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and negotiation abilities.
* Data-driven decision-making skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Strong project management skills.
* A passion for innovation and driving business growth.

title: Associate Recruiter, Recruiting
company: Amazon Dev Center India - Hyderabad - A85
description:
- 6+ months of human resources experience
- 6+ months of Microsoft Office products and applications experience
- Experience in confidential environments
  

“Many of the problems we face have no textbook solution, and so we-happily-invent new ones.” – Jeff Bezos  

  

Amazon’s mission is to be Earth’s most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. Amazon’s evolution from website to c-commerce and publishing partner to development platform is driven by the pioneering spirit that is part of the company’s DNA. More than 268,900 employees worldwide keep the wheels turning at Amazon, with global corporate offices in Australia, Singapore, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Mexico, Slovakia, Spain, the United Kingdom, and the United States.  

  

We create. We build. We take ownership for what we do – whether we’re developing a new technology in-house or launching a new Fulfillment Center. Together, we’re constantly creating the ideas, services and products that make life easier for Amazon’s millions of customers. Regardless of role, each Amazonian is completely focused on working hard, having fun and making history.  

  

About Amazon India:  

We made our foray into the Indian market with the launch of Junglee.com, enabling retailers in India to advertise their products to millions of Indian shoppers and drive targeted traffic to their stores. In June 2013, we launched www.amazon.in for shoppers in India with an endeavor to give customers more of what they want – low prices, vast selection, fast and reliable delivery, and a trusted and convenient online shopping experience. In India we have 40+ fulfillment centers which are operational and are spread across some of the major cities, with over a total storage area of 5.5 million square feet+. Amazon India operations has distribution centers in over 250+ cities, having over 42+ sort centers and delivering to over 19000 pin codes in India.  

We are proud to have some of the finest talent and leaders with proven experience working to make Amazon the Earth’s most customer-centric company.  

  

Our Recruiters work in a fast-paced, high volume recruiting organization. Each plays an important role in managing recruiting activities and building candidate relationships —often providing candidates with their first impression of Amazon. The ideal person will be an organizational guru, work effectively with internal and external clients and candidates, possess great communication skills, have the ability to shift gears at a moment’s notice and enjoy the challenges of helping to build a great organization of talented individuals. This is an amazing opportunity for someone looking to broaden their experience and work in a top recruiting organization.
  

  

The recruiter for the Operations vertical would be responsible towards delivering the critical hiring demand from the India operations business to support Amazon’s aggressive growth plans. The incumbent will partner with business leaders to identify and strategize their short term and long term hiring needs. They will build effective candidate generation and sourcing strategies for volume hiring as well as niche positions, while ensuring great candidate experience. The ideal candidate should have demonstrated innovation, strategy and should be able to resolve complex business problems.
  

  

Summary of Responsibilities
  

  

* Support execution of recruiting plans to meet the hiring requirements.
* Manage all aspects of candidate administration such as maintaining and updating applicant, scheduling activity, sharing job description, ensuring current positions are accurately posted in all recruiting systems and job boards.
* Build and maintain an active pool of candidates to meet future hiring targets in an effective manner.
* Effectively manage relationships with agencies (as applicable).
* Responsible for planning and coordinating of events, assessment and interviews for hiring candidates.
* Review applications to evaluate if they meet the requirements of position.
* Serves as liaison with candidates and communicate logistics associated with assessment and interviews.
* Coordinate with background check agency to complete background checks for shortlisted candidates.
* Collate documents of shortlisted candidates and share them with on-boarding team.
* Shadow recruiters in the regular follow-up meetings with hiring managers to determine the effectiveness of recruiting plans and implementation.
* Provides advice and assistance to all levels of personnel on various recruiting/talent acquisition related matters.

  

  

  

  

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:  

  

Bengaluru, KA, IND
  

- 1+ years of human resources experience
- 1+ years of Microsoft Office products and applications experience

title: Product Mgmt/Strategy Snr Manager-ProdDev
description:
Manage a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget. The Senior Manager of Product Management is a member of the product management team that works closely with their Portfolio Lead to help manage a team of Product Owners to deliver on the roadmap.


They also work with the Portfolio Lead, UX team and development teams interpreting the roadmap through the eyes of the customer to help solve customer problems in the most effective way.


The Senior Manager of Product Management will seek input from various stakeholders, help with the growth of the assigned Product Owners. He/She will support the Portfolio Lead in balancing the roadmap of conflicting priorities and help communicate the path forward.


The focus of the Senior Manager of Product Management will be to grow a team of Product Owners to act in a way to not simply deliver “features” but instead understand problems, collaboratively solving problems, and delivering capabilities that customers love and use. Like the Portfolio Lead, you will be measured on key KPIs including not just financial & ROI, but also adoption and satisfaction metrics for solutions. In other words, do customer use the solution and do they like it.


You will drive for consistency, a culture of delivery and customer satisfaction, with 5 key measures:


* Adoption “Are people using it?”
* Customer Satisfaction “Do they like it?”
* Financial “Are they buying it?”
* ROI “Are we making money?”
* Employee satisfaction “Are we aligned?”
Career Level - M3


  
This is a position that requires a combination of strong engagement and communication skills, people management, pragmatic thinking, tactical execution, and the ability to balance an ever-challenging mix of priorities and stakeholder views. You should be experienced in creating people growth plans, participating in the creation of business plans, go to market plans and launch plans for a global business. You will be working directly with your Portfolio Lead, Product Experience & Product Development to deliver product offerings that grow the business.


In this position, along with your team, you will collaborate with sales, pre-sales, product marketing, corporate marketing, and customer support to define the best path forward for your products. You will engage with product development and product experience to ensure products are delivered to delight customers. You will also act as a main representative for your stream internally and externally. Engaging with internal teams, customers, and partners will be common.


Key responsibilities include:


* Growing a team of Product Owners to excel in “building the product right”.
* Understand the customer and their needs and is their advocate.
* Understand the market, customers and product management strategy and convey these contexts to the team.
* Work with your Portfolio Lead and ensure the creation, management, and prioritisation of a product backlog by your team, and for assessing whether what the team produces is appropriate to release to market.
* Work hand-in-hand with product development, particularly the Product Owners, and product experience teams to ensure alignment of objectives, timely delivery and positive customer outcomes .
* Ensure that what we build adds up to meaningful experiences for our customers.
* Work with the team and stakeholders to understand team capacity and realistic workloads.
* Support the Portfolio Lead in developing commercial and market plans.
* Ensure customer facing departments understand the changes we make to our products.
* Proactively contribute to ongoing process improvement and ensure high quality outcomes for our customers.
* Pro-active in helping others through building capability and supporting peers.
* Communicate with and get buy in from key stakeholders, including external (our customers) and internal. Continue to make development, marketing, support and importantly sales and pre-sales feel good about your team’s offerings and direction.
* Make decisions based on specific and deep market and metrics analysis.
* Work with the Portfolio Lead to measure and report on the success of your solutions, particularly around adoption and satisfaction.

The Senior Manager of Product Management will be a flexible, results-oriented, and experienced product management professional. This role combines a great instinct for evolving a product culture; developing compelling products with a strong focus on users; a technical aptitude to work with a world class development team; and the business sense to drive product goals and strategies.  



Leadership
* Ensure growth of Product Owners.
* Ensure effective integration and co-ordination between the Product Strategy, Product Experience and Product Development.
Ensure implementation of effective team management for all teams (regular meetings, work flow allocation, prioritization)  
* 

Commercial
* Assist the Portfolio Lead with:
	+ Managing the entire product line life cycle from strategic planning to tactical activities.
	+ Specify market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research supported by on-going visits to customers and other industry stakeholders.
	+ Drive a solution set across development team (primarily Development/Engineering and Marketing Communications) through market requirements, product contract and positioning.
	+ Analyze potential partner relationships for the product.
	Set and deliver commercial targets for the product  
	+

General
* Understand the competitors’ products in terms of positioning, features and benefits, and account acquisition strategies
Build an excellent knowledge of the Industries GBU products, mapping how the new product set interfaces to the existing product set.  
* 

Candidate Requirements
Required Skills and Experience


Essential:


* Strong people management background
* 5+ years product management or technical product marketing experience required.
* Some SaaS or network-based business expertise
* Experience making sophisticated product decisions in a competitive market and getting it right!
* Must always be thinking about the customer. Must be maniacal about focusing on product issues and initiatives that will create engaged and happy users (which ultimately generate revenue).
* Have a strong business sense and ability to grasp customer’s needs and expectations. Given the broad-based product responsibilities this individual will assume, strong project management skills and the ability to manage multiple parallel initiatives and stakeholders will be critical.
* Demonstrated ability to gather user requirements and convert them into a winning product vision.
* Significant people and organizational management skills.

Desirable:


* Experience in Agile/SAFe Development
* Experience working in a fast-growing business
* Experience with organizations in the never-ending process of transitioning to Agile development methodologies.

title: Architect - Print Solutions
description:
HP Inc. is one of the world’s most prolific technology businesses and brands. Our company’s vision is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere. HP Inc. was reborn in 2015 as a worldwide leader in personal systems and printing, with a legacy of innovation and the heart of a start-up.


As a lead architect for Print Solutions catering to enterprise customers you will be building highly scalable and secure solutions which will be deployed in different customer environments (On-Prem, Cloud & Hybrid environment) backed by predictive analytics that powers our enterprise business. These products will connect with thousands of Printers to manage those printers and collect data.


Some of the world class Print Manageability Products that HP offers to their enterprise customers & partners are **HP Command Center****,** **HP Security Manager** and**HP Command Center**.


Do you love working on cutting-edge cloud & web technologies? Are you hands-on? Do you love to design, code, drive the product and influence the team? Are you a techie who is customer-focused as well? We want you to join our amazing team of engineers and architects and do all those and more.

*Responsibilities:*

* Design and architect highly scalable hybrid products using Web Technologies, AWS technologies or similar technologies.
* Build platforms & components that can be deployed across deployments.
* Exceptional at understanding and designing Microservices and Micro Front Ends.
* Be hands-on. Explore new design ideas, create prototypes, and influence the technical team.
* Engage with product management to understand the product requirements and create technical specs.
* Produce high-level and low-level designs which include component diagrams, sequence diagrams, technology choices, API specs, Database schemas.
* Do periodic code reviews with scrum teams and make sure that the right product is being built.
* Be the pioneer at exploring new design patterns and introduce the team to different design practices. Be the technical guru and mentor to the development scrum teams.
* Do regular security reviews and design reviews of the peer.

*Leadership:*

* Must be transparent and have a growth mindset.
* Great communication skills.
* Must be open-minded, collaborative and drive by influence.
* Ability to obtain information from Product Owners and break down the problem into smaller tasks.
* Must be a mentor for other developers in the company.
* Must demonstrate ownership of the projects they work on.
* Must align with the principles of the HP Way (trust and respect, focus on achievement and contribution, uncompromising integrity, teamwork, innovation)

*Requirements:*

* 15+ years of experience in software engineering
* 5+ years of experience in Software Architecture, Building scalable cloud-native applications.
* Proficient in different AWS tech stacks.
* Practitioner of cloud security, privacy, and compliance
* Bachelor or master in computer science or related fields.
* Experience in building solutions from the ground up.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English
* Strong programming skills, data structures, parallel computing, and object-oriented design.
* Must be able to contribute to design and code reviews and help developers in troubleshooting/problem-solving.
* Knowledgeable of application performance and resource consumption optimization.
* Ability to simplify complex and abstract issues.

title: Manager Product Design
description:
Razorpay was founded by Shashank Kumar and Harshil Mathur in 2014. Razorpay is building a new-age digital banking hub (Neobank) for businesses in India with the mission is to enable frictionless banking and payments experiences for businesses of all shapes and sizes. What started as a B2B payments company is processing billions of dollars of payments for lakhs of businesses across India.



We are a full-stack financial services organisation, committed to helping Indian businesses with comprehensive and innovative payment and business banking solutions built over robust technology to address the entire length and breadth of the payment and banking journey for any business. Over the past year, we've disbursed loans worth millions of dollars in loans to thousands of businesses. In parallel, Razorpay is reimagining how businesses manage money by simplifying business banking (via Razorpay X) and enabling capital availability for businesses (via Razorpay Capital).
**The Role :**



We're seeking an exceptional design leader to manage and guide a team of talented multidisciplinary designers in one of the fastest growing tech startups of the nation to drive it towards becoming the best design team in the industry.


**Roles and Responsibilities:**


**Manage the team and the work**


* Own a team of multi-disciplinary designers consisting of product designers, visual designers, visual communication designers and researchers.
* Along with the design leads, manage various design projects and their priorities. Help the team in resolving blockers. Ensure the output meets business goals, deadlines and the quality bar.


**Shape up product direction and drive design-led projects**


* Take part in ideation, planning and prioritization of our diverse range of products & features keeping the short and long-term goals of the organization in mind.
* Find out new directions that we can take in our quest to make payments and finance easy and accessible to all.
* Strategise, prioritize and drive design-led projects. Also, help to extend the existing design systems and build new ones.


**Mentor, Guide and Lead the Team**


* You will be responsible for the growth of the team. Help them grow their soft and hard skills. Help them define their career paths, identify opportunities and level up to do the best work of their lives.


**Raise the Bar**


* You will set the bar high. You know what quality looks like and how to help product teams ship at that quality with minimal impact on velocity.


**Drive and improve the design process**


* Iterate upon and improve the design processes to introduce the best practices within the team. Bring in users to the center of the process and encourage design decisions to be backed by user-behavior and data.
* Create frameworks and guidelines for the team to deliver better and faster.
* Conduct design reviews and status meetings. Facilitate design sprints, workshops, brainstorming sessions.
* Prioritize research and design improvement opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Share engineering principles to guide the team from an engineering point of view.

Razorpay believes in and follows an equal employment opportunity policy that doesn't discriminate on gender, religion, sexual orientation, colour, nationality, age, etc. We welcome interests and applications from all groups and communities across the globe.

title: Privacy Manager
description:
Eightfold was founded with a vision to solve for employment in our society. For decades, the connection between individuals and opportunities has been based on who they are and their network's strength vs. their potential. Eightfold leverages artificial intelligence to transform how to think about skills and capabilities for individuals and how jobs and career decisions are made. Eightfold offers the industry’s first AI-powered Talent Intelligence Platform to transform how organizations plan, hire, develop and retain a diverse workforce, enabling individuals to transform their careers.  

  

To date, Eightfold AI has received more than $410 million in funding and a valuation of over $2B from leading investors to further our mission of finding the right career for everyone in the world. If you are passionate about solving one of the most fundamental challenges of our society - employment, working on hard business problems, and being part of an amazing growth story - Eightfold is the place to be!  

  

**About the Role**We are looking for an experienced Privacy Manager to join our team. The Privacy Manager will be responsible for helping ensure the protection and privacy of personal data in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and policies. The position will be responsible for understanding the main data flows between Eightfold and our customers, vendors, and other third parties; enhancing and maintaining the TrustArc data map; supporting privacy champions within the organization; and developing and maintaining documentation. The Privacy Manager will support key privacy initiatives and a variety of privacy projects for the privacy compliance program.  

  

The ideal candidate will have significant experience in privacy management, a strong understanding of privacy laws and regulations, and excellent analytical and communication skills. This position is an individual contributor role and reports to the Director, Product & Privacy at Eightfold (privacy counsel). The position will work closely with the Information Security and Compliance team at Eightfold.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:*** • With privacy counsel, conduct privacy assessments and identify potential areas of non-compliance with privacy laws and regulations
* • Update existing and develop new privacy policies, contract templates, and procedures to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations
* Support responses to data subject requests
* • Support the review of data processing agreements with customers and vendors
* • Review and evaluate the privacy implications of new initiatives and products
* • Provide guidance to employees and stakeholders on privacy-related matters
* • Develop and deliver training programs to educate employees on privacy policies and procedures
* • Provide guidance and support to business units to ensure privacy considerations are incorporated into their activities and initiatives
* • Monitor and investigate privacy incidents and breaches
* • Support the maintenance of accurate and up-to-date records of privacy incidents
* • Work with legal and compliance teams to ensure compliance with data protection regulations
* • Assist in the development and maintenance of data inventories and data maps
* • Support vendor compliance risk assessments with respect to the handling of personal data
* • Provide guidance on the use of data and data sharing arrangements
• Utilize contract, documentation management, and other legaltech tools to provide and support legal operations in the department.  
* 

  

**Qualification:*** • At least 5 years of experience as a privacy analyst, privacy specialist, or manager at a B2B cloud software company
* • At least 2 years experience working with OneTrust, TrustArc or other tools used to facilitate data mapping, data inventories, data subject rights requests, and incident management
* • Proven ability to analyze and present findings in a clear and cohesive manner.
* • Strong understanding of privacy laws and regulations, including GDPR and CCPA
* • Experience working with technology, IT systems, and data collection and governance practices
* • Strong attention to detail
* • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* • Strong organizational and project management skills
* • Paralegal experience helpful but not required
* • Professional certification such as CIPP, CIPT, or CIPM desired
• Bachelor's degree in a related field such as information management, information security, or computer science preferred  
* 

  

If you have a passion for privacy and data protection, and want to work with a dynamic team in the growing area of AI and HR Tech, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity.  

﻿  

We are a team of self-starters who excel in their fields. We believe in giving you responsibility, not a task. We want you to have ownership and pride in your work and see your work's positive impact on your colleagues, our customers, and the world. We believe in providing transparency and support so you can do the best work of your career.  

  

**Hybrid Work @ Eightfold:** We embrace a hybrid work model that aims to boost collaboration, enhance our culture, and drive innovation through a blend of remote and in-person work. We are committed to creating a dynamic and flexible work environment that nurtures the collaborative spirit of our team. Starting February 1, 2024, employees residing near Santa Clara, California, or our Bangalore and Noida offices in India will return to the office twice a week.
Eightfold.ai provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or disability.  

  

Experience our comprehensive benefits with family medical, vision and dental coverage, a competitive base salary, and eligibility for equity awards and discretionary bonuses or commissions.  

  

Our customer stories- https://eightfold.ai/customers/customer-stories/
Press- https://eightfold.ai/about/press

title: Principal Product Manager
description:
At Reltio®, we believe data should fuel business success. Reltio's AI-powered data unification and management capabilities—encompassing entity resolution, multi-domain master data management (MDM), and data products—transform siloed data from disparate sources into unified, trusted, and interoperable data. The Reltio Connected Data Platform™ delivers interoperable data where and when it's needed, empowering data and analytics leaders with unparalleled business responsiveness. Leading enterprise brands—across multiple industries around the globe—rely on our award-winning data unification and cloud-native MDM capabilities to improve efficiency, manage risk and drive growth.



At Reltio, our values guide everything we do. With an unyielding commitment to prioritizing our "Customer First", we strive to ensure their success. We embrace our differences and are "Better Together" as One Reltio. We are always looking to "Simplify and Share" our knowledge when we collaborate to remove obstacles for each other. We hold ourselves accountable for our actions and outcomes and strive for excellence. We "Own It". Every day, we innovate and evolve, so that today is "Always Better Than Yesterday". If you share and embody these values, we invite you to join our team at Reltio and contribute to our mission of excellence.



Reltio has earned numerous awards and top rankings for our technology, our culture and our people. Reltio was founded on a distributed workforce and offers flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives. If you're ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to enable digital transformation with connected data, let's talk!


**Job Summary:**



As a Principal Product Manager at Reltio, you will be responsible for managing and growing Reltio's current product offerings. You will work with a cross-functional team, understand market demands, competitors and other influencing factors and define product roadmap, plan releases and deliver product capabilities following best-practices and will support the go-to-market functions to ensure customer adoption and drive business outcomes. You will regularly report to the leadership team to review product strategy, roadmap, release plan and other key business metrics. You should bring an enthusiastic, team-player attitude, foster cooperation with other departments, and drive innovation and customer adoption for your product areas. You should be able to identify opportunities for product and process improvements and drive results.


**Job Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Business strategy – Perform market research to identify and quantify high value customer needs and build product roadmap, positioning and pricing strategies to address those needs.
* Product strategy and delivery – Be responsible for all Go-to-Market coordination. Drive alignment across sales, product management, engineering and product marketing functions to deliver products and solutions for the customer.
* Leadership – Develop, facilitate and drive cross-functional initiatives & alignment with key partner organizations, including Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Services, Support, and Partners. This includes managing agile processes for product launches, customer validations, and partner and sales enablement
* Evangelism – Be a thought leader, a Reltio subject-matter expert and communicate key aspects and benefits of our offerings to prospects, customers, partners, industry analysts, and internal audiences


**Skills You Must Have:**


* 15+ years of total experience with 10+ years of product management experience. Management consulting experience at a top tier firm a plus
* Domain experience in one of the following industries: Health care, Life Sciences, Financial Services, High Tech, Retail, Travel & Hospitality or CPG
* Prior experience in Master Data Management, Big Data technologies, Machine Learning, Analytics, and Customer Experience
* Good communication skills with ability to present complex topics for audiences of varying technical / business acumen
* Ability to solve complex problems in a fast-moving environment
* Bachelor's degree or higher with a technical discipline. MBA is a plus


**Skills That Are Nice to Have:**


* Familiarity with roadmap and SDLC tools to build and communicate vision, business plans, roadmaps, personas and GTM strategy is a plus

  

*Reltio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Reltio is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.*

title: Experienced Electronics Product Support IPT Lead
description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.


Boeing is the world’s largest (Per Boeing LinkedIn page) aerospace company and a leading provider of commercial airplanes, defense, space, and security systems, and global services. Building on a legacy of over a century of innovation and leadership, Boeing continues to lead the way in technology and innovation, customer delivery, and investment in its people and future growth of aerospace.


In India, Boeing has been a strong partner to the Indian aerospace and defense sectors for more than 75 years. People at Boeing have been supporting mission readiness and modernization of India’s defense forces, and enabling connected, safer, and smarter flying experiences, in the sky, in the seas, and in space.

**Technology for today and tomorrow**

The Boeing India Engineering & Technology Center (BIETC) is a 3000+ diverse engineering workforce that contributes to global aerospace growth. Our engineers deliver cutting-edge R&D, innovation, and high-quality engineering work in global markets, and leverage new-age technologies such as AI/ML, IIoT, Cloud, Model-Based Engineering, and Additive Manufacturing, shaping the future of aerospace.

**People-driven culture**

At Boeing, we believe creativity and innovation thrives when every employee is trusted, empowered, and has the flexibility to choose, grow, learn, and explore. We offer variable arrangements depending upon business and customer needs, and professional pursuits that offer greater flexibility in the way our people work. We also believe that collaboration, frequent team engagements, and face-to-face meetings bring diverse perspectives and thoughts – enabling every voice to be heard and every perspective to be respected. No matter where or how our teammates work, we are committed to positively shaping people’s careers and being thoughtful about employee wellbeing.


At Boeing, we are **inclusive, diverse, and transformative.**

With us, you can create and contribute to what matters most in your career, community, country, and world. Join us in powering the progress of global aerospace.

**Position Overview:**


The Boeing Company is looking for an **Experienced Product Support IPT Lead**, for Electronics Product team located at **Bangalore, India**. Boeing India Engineering to ensure all required templates and reporting is aligned for all business reviews such as: Integrated Baseline Review (IBR), Product Line Review (PLR), and any other required program management reviews.

**Position Responsibilities:**

The successful candidate will perform the following duties:


You will be responsible for the development of product sustenance of fielded electronics hardware and its firmware for avionics application in close co-ordination with software, firmware, mechanical and certification authorities. You will engage into planning, tracing performance to planned progress to sustain the products at factory and customers. You will work with other concurrent engineering teams such as software and certification authorities to prove compliance upon developed hardware through traceability and related tools.

* Develops or supports product team leader with the Integrated Master Plan, Integrated Master Schedule and supporting elements, drives program planning through the Enterprise Gated Process in support of the Program execution plan.
* Is the assigned Cost Account Manager or assists Product Line CAMs for a program and monitors/tracks performance on plan versus actuals for earned value reporting.
* Identifies, analyzes and reports schedule performance variances with detailed data to include performance to plan and estimate at complete reporting updates.
* Prepares, develops, coordinates, integrates, analyzes and maintains, integrated plans and schedules for Product development programs.
* Creates, tracks and provides status on program execution and performs detailed risk analysis
* Manages small to medium projects with minimal mentorship from Program Group
* Leads project reviews with Larger Program Teams through events such as PDR, CDR and TRR
* Lead technical scope development through robust traceable compliance metrics and standards
* Responsible for developed Project Plan, schedule, resource plan and project budget within the project team
* Responsible to understand and report the project technical plan to progress against TPMs decided
* Responsible for supervising engineering achievements like on time delivery, quality etc.
* Responsible to seamlessly guide a technical team towards scope and resolving intra functional and inter functional conflicts for unified project team goals
* Responsible to co-ordinate with supply chain/sourcing and regulatory authorities for hardware development globally
* Works with functional leaders in engineering, Finance, T&E, supply chain, IT&DA and production to address product line needs and resolve critical items to support product development and deliveries
* Performs schedule, event and change impact analysis

**Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):**

* Bachelor’s Degree or higher is required.
* 9+ years of direct project management experience in technical product development environments for Electronic products comprising firmware
* Lead hardware development over display products, communication products and Data center products
* Experience with FAA (commercial) or defense airworthiness certification requirements and good understanding of CAR Requirements
* Experience in doing product changes through documentations with certification authorities

**Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience)**:

* PMP Certification and/or Agile Certifications

**Typical Education & Experience:**

Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g. Master+8 years' related work experience, etc.)

**Relocation:**


This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility within INDIA.

 **Export Control Requirements:** Not an export control position **Equal Opportunity Employer:**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.


We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world’s most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. We are proud members of the Valuable 500 and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process. Accommodations may include but are not limited to: conducting interviews in accessible locations that accommodate mobility needs, encouraging candidates to bring and use any existing assistive technology such as screen readers and offering flexible interview formats such as virtual or phone interviews.

title: Sr Engineering Manager - Target India
description:
**About Target**: As a Fortune 50 company with more than 450,000 team members worldwide, Target is an iconic brand and one of America's leading retailers. Working at Target means the opportunity to help all families discover the joy of everyday life. Caring for our communities is woven into who we are, and we invest in the places we collectively live, work and play. We prioritize relationships, fuel and develop talent by creating growth opportunities, and succeed as one Target team. At our core, our purpose is ingrained in who we are, what we value, and how we work. It’s how we care, grow, and win together.

  

Target as a tech company? Absolutely. We’re the behind-the-scenes powerhouse that fuels Target’s passion and commitment to cutting-edge innovation. We anchor every facet of one of the world’s best-loved retailers with a strong technology framework that relies on the latest tools and technologies—and the brightest people—to deliver incredible value to guests online and in stores. Target Technology Services is on a mission to offer the systems, tools and support that guests and team members need and deserve. Our high-performing teams balance independence with collaboration, and we pride ourselves on being versatile, agile and creative. We drive industry-leading technologies in support of every angle of the business, and help ensure that Target operates smoothly, securely and reliably from the inside out.

**About Team**: The Service Center team at our enterprise is dedicated to elevating services for our guests, team members, and partners by delivering memorable experiences and advancing technology and platform modernization. The team is focused on digital modernization, enhancing self-service through chatbots, and enabling omnichannel contact centers. We are actively building new core capabilities using technologies such as micro-frontends, microservices, React.js, Salesforce, Genesys, and Generative AI. Currently, we are migrating our technology solutions to the cloud. Our goal is to construct everything at scale, accommodating users across various geographies with a strong emphasis on compliance and risk management. We aim to develop an industry-leading contact center, as well as case and knowledge solutions for our consumers that not only embody Target’s purpose but also provide valuable data and insights for meaningful actions across the enterprise

**About SEM**: The Sr. Engineering Manager (SEM) is responsible for a managing a team of full stack engineers that is building highly innovative and cutting edge robotics solutions. This role is accountable for leading a team, developing code, deploying and managing in production. Most importantly, the SEM, while working with the Product owners drives the product Net promoter score (NPS), user satisfaction, building the product roadmap and delivering highly functional, exceptionally innovative and intelligent software. You will be called upon to be the technical representative for your team during cross-team collaborative efforts and planning. Success in this role will require strong and innovative approaches to problem solving, great technical leadership, excellent communication (written and verbal, formal and informal), flexibility, accountability and a self-motivated working style with attention to detail. Core responsibilities of this job are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.


Use your skills, experience and talents to be a part of groundbreaking thinking and visionary goals. As a Sr. Engineering Manager, you’ll take the lead as you…  

Drive product development and operations with lead engineers and drive technical decision making, adhering to Target platform architecture and other enterprise decisions. You’ll have a strong focus on team management and development, equal focus will be on writing production code and hands on active development of the capabilities and solutions. Assist in defining infrastructure need, internal vs. external cloud and use of Target enterprise solution and drive resolution of technology roadblocks including code, infrastructure, build and deployment and managing overall software development cycle by adhering to development and security standards. Establish good stakeholder communication and work closely with Product teams and influence set product roadmap and help drive requirements while being a strong advocate of extreme agile and DevOps practices across engineers. Build and manage a team of high performing full stack engineers and provide leadership, coaching, motivation and recommend staffing levels, operating procedures, tools and systems for the team. Provide career development and performance management to a team of engineers.


Core responsibilities of this job are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.

 **About you:**  

* 4 year degree in or equivalent experience
* 7+ years of engineering (software development) experience
* 1-3 years of managing teams with a strong track record of delivery for cross-functional product experience with Cloud hosting and managing products
* Proficient in building high performing APIs and writing specs
* Expertise in 2 or more of the programming languages
* Experience with integration, data handling technologies and other open source frameworks
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to variety of audiences
* Team-orientated, passionate about developing others’ skills and capabilities
* Successful track record of working in large enterprise technology ecosystems leading complex technology teams
* Deep understanding of agile development processes and methodology including continuous integration and delivery, with a mindset of building incrementally and delivering business value quickly

title: Sales Support - Pricing Manager
description:
**Sales Support - Pricing Manager**
===================================

#### **Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.**

  

You will be working as Sales Support - Pricing Manager and reporting to Sales Manager and will be part of Motion Business for Drive Products division, based in Bangalore, India. In this role you will be responsible for contributing to the development and implementation of pricing strategies for the relevant division or business unit or product group, to maximize profit and market share, while ensuring customer satisfaction with ABB. Following a robust pricing infrastructure and pricing policies to deliver measurable results.

### **Your responsibilities**

* Achieving the sales targets drive products with profitability and responsible for the pricing support to sales team and partners
* Working together with market manager, product sales managers for business growth and key data management for drive products (SAP / BIW /Atlas reports)
* Leading efforts within organisation to respond quickly and effectively to business opportunities and driving business growth with channel partners with proper business planning & intime support
* Tracking of SFDC major opportunities and regular follow-up with FES
* Co-ordinating with service team for warranty and after sales support as needed and interacting regularly with channel partner sales engineer to drive them to meet commitment
* Regularly giving update on business done product line wise and market wise and preparing monthly MIS and submit to stake holders
* Systematically tracking the key projects and customer activity

### **Your background**

* Degree in BE/ B.Tech or Diploma
* Minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in relevant field
* Experience in Drive distribution market
* Good knowledge on the Drives & Automation is preferred
* Aggressive and result oriented, should know to sell volumes and values
* Must have good communication skills

### **More about us**


ABB Drive Products is a technology leader serving industries, infrastructure and machine builders with world-class drives. With our products, global scale and local presence, we help our customers to improve energy efficiency, productivity and safety. Our people and culture are the foundation of our success. We all together make the difference for our customers every day. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning Work model: on site #LI-onsite

title: Ad Sales Manager – Growth Brands, Amazon Advertising
description:
1) 1-2 years of experience in sales.
  
2) Strong communication skills (written and verbal). 3) MBA or other related Master's degree
  
4) Confidence in the analysis of number-based reports and experience in MS Office (esp. Excel).
  
5) An exceptional eye for detail, ability to solve problems and given the fast-paced nature of our division, the aptitude to multi task.
  
6) An organized approach and a real team player who is willing to roll up sleeves.
  
  

The Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of Advertising and e-Commerce and offers advertisers a rich array of innovative advertising solutions across Amazon.in. These solutions help businesses build brand awareness, increase product sales, and more.
  
As a recognized and experienced expert in this fast-growing business, you will take responsibility for a portfolio of leading Consumer companies as an ecommerce marketing consultant. You will advise your customers from the initial contact to the long-term development of a partnership. In doing so, you will act on the same level as senior decision-makers on the customer side and define holistic marketing strategies, leveraging all of Amazon’s innovative advertising solutions. Our goal is to establish and expand long-term business relations, and drive sustainable success for our advertiser customers.
  
To achieve that, you will completely own the advertising revenue of your portfolio and lead the engagement with your customers, supported by a cross-functional team of account managers, program managers, analysts and designers. By managing your sales pipeline independently, gaining a deep understanding of the needs of your brands and the ecosystem, and developing convincing solutions you will ensure the achievement of your short and long-term objectives.
  
If you are excited to work in the fast-paced and rapidly evolving e-commerce marketing space, have a consultative selling style and yield from the Electronics/FMCG/Durable/marketing/media/Sales & Key account management/consulting world, please apply
  
This position is based at the Amazon India office in Bengaluru/Mumbai, with 20-30% travel as required
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Analyze data, trends, performance and leverage your understanding of marketing and Amazon's advertising solutions to create holistic marketing strategies for brands by working with senior decision-makers on the customer side.
* Act as the advertisers’ advocate to evangelize for their success working with Amazon India, by partnering with product, account management, support, and global technology teams to drive advertiser success on Amazon’s advertising platform.
* Establish and build strong, profitable, long-term relationships with strategic advertisers. Contribute to the overall growth and profit of Amazon India’s business by expanding our partner ecosystem.
* Serve as a key member of advertising business development team, helping to drive overall Amazon Advertising strategy and business growth.
* Build scale into the business development function by collaborating with internal stakeholders (vendor managers, seller sales and account teams) to develop joint business plans and upsell opportunities with coherent messaging/positioning for vendors/sellers/partners.
* Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to increasing adoption customers.


We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
  
  

Bengaluru, KA, IND
  
  

1) Professional experience with online advertising
  
2) Experience in e-commerce, retail or advertising
  
3) Experience interpreting data and making business recommendations
  
4) Demonstrated high attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

title: Solution Manager - AM-TECH-DA-03 SOL MGR
description:
At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future.
### **Duties**

* Collaborates with global technology, operations and product partners to co-develop a roadmap and drive product features from concept to launch in an agile environment.
* Turns insights into product features with actionable outcomes
* Works in an Agile environment and continuously reviews the business needs, refines priorities, outlines milestones and deliverables, and identifies opportunities and risks.
* Develops, owns, and executes product roadmap.
* Translates product roadmap features into well-defined product requirements including features, user stories, and acceptance test criteria.
* Prioritizes and maintains the sprint backlog for assigned products, balancing the requirements of stakeholders.
* Manage projects with top-down oversight throughout entire execution to ensure success
* Develop comprehensive project plans that merge stakeholder requirements with company goals and coordinate various managers and technical personnel during all project phases.
* Monitor project progress continuously and make scheduled reports on measurable items, such as milestones and deliverables.
* Communicate proactively with all involved personnel to provide encouragement, identify problems, create solutions, and implement efficiency improvements.
* Review proposed modifications on project plans, including meeting with interested parties to approve and implement beneficial changes.
* Anticipate details of future projects by communicating directly with stakeholders and staying informed of relevant trends and industry news
* Guides and coaches an Engineering Scrum Team on how to use Agile practices and principles to deliver high quality products and services to our customers.
* Coaches the Scrum team in self-organization, cross-functional skillset, domain knowledge and communicates effectively, both internally and externally working within the Scrum team.
* Works with Scrum Team, as well as internal and external stakeholders, to influence and drive decision making and support organizational project or product teams.
* Resolves team impediments with other Scrum Masters to increase the effectiveness of the application of Scrum in the organization.
* Contributes to the advancement and improvement of Agile practices within the organization.
* Facilitates and supports all scrum events: Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective.

### **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience
* 5 years of project management, product ownership or software product development experience
* Proven track record of delivering data driven solutions with a customer-first mindset
* Established background in launching software or services in partnership with engineering teams and high degree of proficiency in iterative development, understanding of Agile principles
* Customer first mindset
* Proactive, self-starter with excellent project management skills and ability to manage multiple tasks effectively
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire partners and stakeholders to drive collaboration and alignment
* High degree of organization, individual initiative, and personal accountability
* Excellent problem-solving skills
* Exemplifies and promotes Agile values and principles
* Outstanding communication, facilitation, negotiation, and coaching skills
* Knowledge of an agile framework or method (i.e. Scrum, Kanban), or understanding of software development life cycle models as well as in-depth knowledge of traditional project management principles and practices

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Description**  
We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Sales Executive with prior experience in Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) sales, Shopify sales, and marketing business sales. The ideal candidate will be passionate about driving sales growth, building strong relationships with clients, and exceeding targets in a fast-paced environment.

**Responsibilities:**

1. Develop and implement sales strategies to drive revenue growth in the Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) and Shopify sales channels.  
2. Identify and target potential clients within the D2C and Shopify ecosystem, including brands, e-commerce businesses, and marketing agencies.  
3. Build and nurture strong relationships with key decision-makers and stakeholders to understand their business needs and challenges.  
4. Conduct product demonstrations and presentations to showcase the value proposition of our solutions, emphasizing how they can address client pain points and drive business growth.  
5. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including marketing, product development, and customer support to ensure alignment in sales efforts and provide feedback on market trends and client needs.  
6. Manage the entire sales process from lead generation to closing deals, including negotiation and contract management.  
7. Meet and exceed sales targets and KPIs set by the management team, consistently striving for excellence and continuous improvement.  
8. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies in the D2C and Shopify space, leveraging this knowledge to position our offerings effectively in the market.  
9. Provide regular reports and updates on sales activities, pipeline status, and revenue projections to the management team.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: ₹400,000.00 - ₹600,000.00 per year

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Business development: 1 year (Required)
* total work: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* English (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Manager, EDU Operations
description:
**Company Description** **Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate!**  

  

Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we’re on a mission to deliver the world’s most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world.  

  

What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you!  

  

**Who we are:**


Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in education, using modern technology.  

  

Today, we’ve digitized payments for more than 3,800+ global clients across education, healthcare, travel & B2B, covering more than 240 countries and territories and supporting over 140 currencies. And, we’re just getting started!


With over 1,200+ global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 12 offices world-wide, we’re looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow.

 **Job Description**  

Flywire’s EDU Operations department exists to facilitate best practice execution and promote global scaling. Our key areas of focus are optimizing client relationships, optimizing internal processes, growing and protecting Flywire’s revenue, and optimizing Sales & Relationship Management teams’ time to focus on driving revenue.


The EDU Operations Manager role supports our mission by working closely with leadership to identify & action process optimizations & process rollouts, facilitate enablement programs & internal trainings, work with subject matter expert teams from varying departments for our central process hub management, and perform gap analysis & optimization of process artifacts, sales enablement material, and other internal resources.


The EDU Operations Manager must have a vision for process improvement, a passion for detail oriented project management, a knack for fostering learning environments, intuitive cross-functional and cross-cultural team building skills, a hunger for professional development and diversifying of responsibilities, and a drive to self-start in the face of ambiguity.


RESPONSIBILITIES

* Guide the EDU organization smoothly into its next stage of growth by introducing programs and operational infrastructure that enable a scalable global footprint.
* Drive the execution of these EDU programs, process changes, and projects with clear communication, prioritization, and escalation (both within the EDU team and other operating groups).
* Project manage operational improvements cross-departmentally and cross-regionally. Use project management tools along with precise goal-setting and timelining to successfully launch projects and carry them to completion.
* Facilitate enablement programs for best practice execution and revenue optimization. Arrange internal training & workshops to drive engagement when needed.
* Maintain ongoing and launched projects and programs.
* Maintain a routine cadence with leadership across our Agents & EDU teams for gap analysis & ongoing improvements.
* Bridge communication with key teams (Product, Implementation, sales, Relationship Management and Marketing) in order to reduce silos and increase job efficiency.Optimize internal signposting to best communicate key info for job efficacy for our global teams, in coordination with task force teams with input from Product, Implementation, Sales, Relationship Management and Marketing.
* Cultivate strong and lasting collaborative relationships with stakeholders across multiple functions across the company, as well as, within our Global Operations team

 **Qualifications*** Ideally, around 5 - 8 years of experience in higher education (or agent) environments, within either project management or operations, or managing customer relationships (or a combination of these fields)
* Proven track record in process improvements and project management
* Strong organizational skills and exceptional attention to detail
* Proven experience with Salesforce, CRMs, as well as project management tools & methodologies
* Training experience and passion for fostering learning environments
* Passion for building and nurturing teams across geographies and departments, comprising of diverse team members from varying backgrounds with varying levels of experience
* The ability to work alone as well as part of a team
* Proficient presentation skills

 **Additional Information** **What We Offer:**

* Competitive compensation, including Restricted Stock Units
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
* Flying Start - Our immersive Global Induction Program (Meet our Execs & Global Teams)
* Work with brilliant people that will keep you on your toes, learn more about their journeys by checking out #InsideFlywire on social media
* Dynamic & Global Team (we have been collaborating virtually for years!)
* Wellbeing Programs (Mental Health, Wellness, Yoga/Pilates/HIIT Classes) with Global FlyMates
* Be a meaningful part in our success - every FlyMate makes an impact
* Competitive time off including FlyBetter Days to volunteer in a cause you believe in and
* Digital Disconnect Days!
* Great Talent & Development Programs (Managers Taking Flight – for new or aspiring managers!)

**Submit today and get started!**


We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect to meet with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a skills assessment. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions.


Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 40 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we’re excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire. #LI-Remote

*Flywire is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: Product Manager - Distributors
description:
Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.
With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.
This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.  

About the role  

Based out of our GCC, this role sits within the Global Digital & Tech Organisation and specifically within the Customer, Consumer & Expert organisation. Reporting to the Head of Salesforce Excellence Products this role will be responsible for identifying, designing and delivering Distributor Management and Distributor Salesforce Automation Tech & Data products that deliver tangible value and great experiences for both our Haleon commercial teams that manage relationships with our Distributors; and the Individuals within the Distributor organisation such as Sales Reps that distribute and sell Haleon products on our behalf. The objective is to increase effectiveness and efficiency and drive sales growth. You will product manage existing tech products such as our Distributor Management System & SFA tool for Distributor Reps.
You will develop a deep understanding of customer needs and business processes, identifying gaps and opportunities to add value. You will create and manage the Product strategy and Roadmap and then partner with vendors and our in-house engineering teams to ship solutions & features that delight our end users and deliver business benefit. You will have an agile mindset and a can-do attitude, and you will be passionate about solving business challenges through technology. To be successful in this role you will need to be comfortable with getting things done in a matrixed environment. This is a global role, and you will work closely with individuals in our commercial excellence / sales organisations and other digital and tech functions.
Key Responsibilities* Lead continuous customer research to understand customer needs (jobs to be done, problems to solve) and identify opportunities to add value.
* Utilize outputs from customer research to build the Product Vision, Product Strategy & Roadmap for the Distributor domain and be able to evangelize this across Tech and within the business units.
* Work with the business owner to pro-actively manage the product backlog – ensuring business problems are well articulated, business value is understood, and demand is prioritized.
* Develop detailed user requirements/user stories and ensure that these are clearly understood by all key stakeholders.
* Rigorously apply the scientific method and lean start-up thinking to set hypotheses, design experiments, test assumptions and break-down complex problems into smaller chunks.
* Work alongside vendors and in-house engineering teams and Architects to turn opportunities into solutions, applying design thinking principles.
* Measure the impact of all new work released on your roadmap, ensuring adoption happens and the value loop is closed.
* Play the role of the ‘Product Owner’ as required during development sprints, making decisions in a timely manner.
* Support the agile delivery process, with a mindset of continuous improvement and optimisation across people, processes, tools and technology. Work with internal and outsourced Agile teams on the end-to-end change & release process, quality assurance and testing.
* Understand product dependencies and ensure risks and issues are clearly tracked and understood by key stakeholders.
* Build strong cross functional partnerships with key business stakeholder as well as aligning across the Haleon Tech organisation on standards relating to platforms, security, vendors and delivery models.
* Maintain high credibility and deliver real value by shipping product that make our users’ lives easier.


Qualifications & skills
Essential* 10+ years proven work experience in a product management role
* Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its life cycle
* Proven ability to develop product roadmaps and strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management
* Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and digital technologies
* Experience of delivering global commercial technology projects using AGILE in a complex, matrix environment
* Excellent understanding of B2B commercial business processes
* Experience and exposure to relevant domains such as Distributor Management Systems, Salesforce Automation Tools, CRM, B2B eCommerce etc.
* Advanced problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done.


Preferred* 12+ years proven work experience in a product management role
* Experience in the Healthcare and / or Fast-Moving Consumer Goods Industry
* Enjoy change and can demonstrate great agility and resilience
* Calm under pressure and able to manage competing demands
* Ability to see the big picture and think beyond immediate area of responsibility
* Experience in the visualisation of analytics insights and metrics in operational systems & BI visualisation tools such as Microsoft Power BI
* Rich experience in design thinking and product discovery, including user research, persona and journey development, and UX & UI
* Experience of having negotiated and managed contracts with vendors.


Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/  

  

At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.  

  

As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.  

  

Haleon is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
